**Ben's First Swimming Lesson**

Ben was eight years old and afraid of water. All his friends could swim, but Ben always stayed on the beach when they went to the pool.

"I want to learn to swim," Ben told his mother.

His mother smiled. "Let's find you a swimming teacher."

The next week, Ben met his instructor, Miss Kelly. She was kind and patient.

"We'll start slowly," Miss Kelly said. "First, let's get used to the water."

Ben stepped into the shallow end of the pool. The water felt cold around his legs.

"Now put your face in the water for just one second," Miss Kelly said.

Ben was scared, but he tried. He held his breath and put his face down. The water covered his nose and eyes. He quickly lifted his head up.

"Great job!" Miss Kelly said.

Every week, Ben learned something new. He learned to float on his back. He learned to kick his legs. He learned to move his arms.

The hardest part was putting it all together. Ben had to kick, move his arms, and breathe at the same time.

After two months, Ben swam across the pool without help.

"I did it!" he shouted happily.

Now Ben loves swimming. He goes to the pool with his friends every weekend.
